bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 107 (Tuesday, June 26, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. MOORE:H.R. 6233.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Clauses 1 and 18 of Section 8 of Article I of theConstitution[Page H5749]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

summary.text:
Family Poverty is Not Child Neglect Act

This bill requires the Department of Health and Human Services to ensure that grants given to states for child protective services systems are not used to separate a child from the child's parent for reasons of poverty.

bill.title: Family Poverty is Not Child Neglect Act

item.title: Family Poverty is Not Child Neglect Act

To amend the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act to ensure that child protective services systems do not permit the separation of children from parents on the basis of poverty, and for other purposes.
Family Poverty is Not Child Neglect Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
